intro: Schlechteranthus parvus, commonly known as the small-flowered schlechteranthus, is a member of the Asteraceae family. It is a small, herbaceous plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. The plant features delicate, daisy-like flowers with yellow centers and white to pale pink petals. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests. Its botanical characteristics make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
